description: Comcast Confessions: when every call is a sales call | The Verge
extended:
In case you didn't already know how awful it is to be a Comcast customer:

"I would be frustrated because I would tell them we need customer service training as much as sales training, but it came from Philly [Comcast’s headquarters] so that’s what we had to deal with. [Managers] would listen to the call, even have secret shoppers call in. If we didn’t ask [customers] to get more products we would be spoken to. Eventually, selling became part of tech support and billing."

description: Use of illicit drugs becomes part of Silicon Valley's work culture - San Jose Mercury News
extended:
Was surprised this is about opiate overdoses and not nootropics. Crazy that heroin use is up nationally 2x in about the last decade, but have anecdotally heard that too. 

Also... don't agree with this fear mongering "it's a short step between hackathons with free red bull to bowls of cocaine and heroin" bit. Eye roll. Think it's more a factor of new money + insane work/personal expectations is often tied to this sort of thing.

description: syntax - Ruby send vs __send__ - Stack Overflow
